intro: Manihot rusbyi, commonly known as the Rusby's arrowleaf, is a species of flowering plant in the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and produces yellowish-green flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and swamps. The plant has a thick, fleshy stem that stores water, adapting it to its often humid and nutrient-poor habitat.
